Title: Building a project that target .NET Framework 4.5 in Visual Studio 2022
Description:
I maintain a few libraries that still target .NET Framework 4.5 (among others). .NET 4.5 has long been out of support, but I try to keep supporting older frameworks in my libraries as long as it’s not a major inconvenience, because many people maintain old applications that can’t easily be updated to a newer framework.
Anyway, until recently, supporting .NET 4.5 wasn’t much of a problem, but today I hit a snag… Before installing VS 2022 on my Surface Pro, I removed VS 2019 and old versions of .

Title: Setting up Serilog in .NET 6
Description: .NET 6 is officially here! A lot has changed under the hood, and if you're kicking off a new project, a lot has changed on the surface, too. For starters, a minimal ASP.NET Core application created using dotnet new web: Doesn't have an explicit Program class, Startup class, or
